channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NM

  • Description: Pallet collapsed inside trailer causing damage to one carton containing four 1-gallon containers of the above described hazardous ~material.. One container was damaged leaking 4 or 5 ounces inside the carton. Container "taped up and spill cleaned." Carton will be left ~at OSandD.

item.title: Report X-2023030815
item.description:
Report X-2023030815

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-16T09:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-06
  • City: BELEN
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The UTLX 212296 leaked approx. 5 gallons of diesel fuel onto track 7103. The leak was from the sample line. Upon investigation, the plug was missing and the needle valve was open. The HazMat Responder closed the valve and taped and tool-tightened the plug.

item.title: Report X-2023030640
item.description:
Report X-2023030640

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-16T09:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-07
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was received in QA due to leakage and place in a hazmat drum. DescribePack: Upon inspection I discovered all the containers were leaking from loose lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: After finding where the leaking was coming from, I tightened all the lids.

item.title: Report X-2023030426
item.description:
Report X-2023030426

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-16T09:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-04
  • City: AZTEC
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from the trailer and put to the side. Package was noticeably wet so it was brought to QA and it was confirmed damaged. DescribePack: Lid does not seal properly so if package is on its side or upside down the liquid will come out of the container. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was moved to the repack area and put inside a tote to contain any contents it may leak out.

item.title: Report X-2023030489
item.description:
Report X-2023030489

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-16T09:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-26
  • City: Lucy
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1325MT at MP 827.9 (Willard) on Clovis Sub near Lucy, NM - Z ALTLAC8 25 reporting derailed on MT2. RDWY 138426 involved and on-side. Contents investigation revealed that approximately 45% of the haz paint related material released as a result of being crushed by freight. Remaining material placed in an overpack container for waste disposal. Impacted soils and debris excavated from site and staged for appropriate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023020626
item.description:
Report X-2023020626

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-16T09:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-08
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023020626 SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA wet and torn, after further inspection package was safely placed in a hazmat drum. DescribePack: Upon inspection found the container was leaking from the cap, even though cap had a seal under the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: After I noticed the package was leaking from the cap i tightened caps and placed the package in a hazmat drum. 2. X-2023020627 SequenceEvent: The package was brought to QA wet and torn, upon inspection I found the failure was due to leaking caps and placed packages in hazmat drum. DescribePack: The failure was due to leaking caps even though it had a seal under cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: After inspecting package, I tightened the caps and place package in a hazmat drum.

item.title: Report I-2023010016
item.description:
Report I-2023010016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-15T21:08:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-07
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12/07/2022 at approximately 0900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5269340 at the station location in Farmington, reporting an undeclared resin spill. The shipment was a fiberboard box, containing a can labeled resin as well as other nonhazardous items. The package emitted an odor during the loading process. Further research revealed that the resin labeled container leaked inside of the box. The package was not labeled in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2022120758
item.description:
Report X-2022120758

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-15T21:08:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-05
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found damaged Hazmat in WA 339 with a dampened base at around 8 PM. Upon realizing package was both hazardous and damaged, placed package into a spill response bucket and brought to the QA cage for further inspection. DescribePack: Upon further inspection of the damaged hazmat, found 1 of 4 contents to have not had the proper packaging (no tape to seal the cap) which ended up causing leakage throughout packaging. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Placed the damaged package within a spill response bucket and took to the QA cage damage area for further inspection.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-01
  • City: GALLUP
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: NM PRC Inspector identified TILX 202029 with a possible release during an inspection of Hazmat in Gallup, NM Terminal. Car was spotted to an accessible track and inspected with a missing gasket determined to be the cause of product around manway nozzle exterior. BNSF Mechanical installed man way gasket to allow continued movement.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED DUE TO BROKEN BEER INSIDE THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE CONSUMER PACKAGE OF AMERICAN CHIEF CONSUMER FIREWORKS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGES HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2022100524

  • City: NEWKIRK

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver stopped for his 10 Hr break and performed his post trip inspection then went for a walk. he returned to the truck after about 10 minutes and noticed the smell of the product. He investigated and observed a small puddle at the rear near the Internal valve. He placed a bucket under the leak and contacted Safety. Carrier contacted the Environmental Agency to handle cleanup, and to assist with a transload of the product.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler discovered the Hazmat in the tail end, passenger side of the trailer upside down(orientation arrows facing down) side by side other hazmats. Package handler then stopped operations by employing the eBrake on the belt system and notified management immediately. Manager then ensured operations were stopped and proceeded to perform in-house clean up using proper PPE. DescribePack: It was discovered that one of the bottles had a loose cap and product had leaked out. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Operations were stopped and Hazmat was removed from the belt system by qualified personnel.

  • City: ALBUQUERQUE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 8, 2022, ten (10) 40 pound-bags of oxidizer were damaged during transit due to a lack of dunnage and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to perform the necessary corrective actions. ER personnel deployed absorbents and worked them in with hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all spent-absorbents into one (1) 30-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This package was found to be leaking during the sort. It was a white outer bag, a plastic box was one layer down with two inner plastic cannisters. The plastic cannisters were not opened so there may have been inner receptacles inside them. There may have been urine samples in the package. Standard spill cleanup procedures were followed and the package was contained in a 1A2 steel salvage drum pending final disposition. Since the contents were UN 3373, Biological Substance Category B from the package markings, the National Response Center was notified by phone. NRC report # is 1344687.

Origin out of Mexico, difficult to track down address.

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-16
  • City: CLOVIS
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: NM State Hazmat Inspector identified CELX 23213 as leaking while in the Clovis yard. The car was isolated and BNSF Hazmat responder inspected the car finding a small leak coming from the liquid line flange below the valve. 2 of 4 bolts were loose and tightened approximately 1 full turn each to stop the leak. Hazmat Hold placed on the car and shipper notified to request OTMA 1 for movement to destination for offloading and shop for repair/testing. All spilled material evaporated from the car body with no ground impacts.

  • City: RINCON

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SHPX 207609 was found in Rincon, NM to be actively leaking front the top of the car. Upon inspection, it was noted that the liquid line was leaking from the cap. The cap was found to be tool tight, but no thread sealant was found on the threads. Responder vented car by opening vent, removed the cap, applied thread sealant and secured the cap, tool tight. Car was cleaned as well as soil remediated and released.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Distracted driving. The truck went off the road and the driver tried to correct it. This caused the trailer to whip off the road and fall on the side. The trailer pulled the truck over on its side. The trailer was pumped off, but during the unloading process a broken valve was missed and 10 gallons of oil hit the ground. Spill kit was utilized and additional cleanup was contracted out.

item.title: Report I-2022070823
item.description:
Report I-2022070823

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-15T21:08:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-04
  • City: Albuquerque
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SANDIA CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: In 2021, our customer(Sandia National Laboratory, SNL) subcontracted Excelitas to return inert scrap(i.e. not containing energetic material) hardware that had accumulated at our Miamisburg, OH facility for over 20+ years of production. The hardware was reviewed by Excelitas and SNL personnel and determined to be material needing to be returned to SNL. The hardware was packaged and shipped to SNL in a corrugated box within a metal AN can. The shipment was offered by Excelitas- Miamisburg on August 17,2021 and consisted of 6. packages- 4 AN cans with scrap material, 1 AN can with packing material, and 1 box with packing material. Transportation was by FedEx. The shipment was delivered to SNL- New Mexico on August 18, 2021. The shipment arrived at SNL- Building 905 around August 25, 2021. The shipment was sent to Building 905 for sorting by the responsible product realization teams(PRTs) in the explosive receipt and inspection area of the facility. PRTs claimed items with continued Value to their programs, with the unclaimed items getting sent to Repplication. This occurred in September 2021. In April 2022, the(part specific) PRT retrieved the"previously" functioned/fired LAT units for potential use in production of trainers, to include the unit in question. While sorting through the units, an SNL technologist identified a single(part specific) actuator that had not fired and was a LIVE unit(containing energetic material). Excelitas was notified on May 4,2022. Research into the history of the unit(SN71357) showed item was from(part specific) Lot 2 (circa December 2011) and had been used in the Neyer Fire Test regime. The records indicate this unit did not fire during testing. The unit contains less than 0.100 grams of TiH1.65KCIO4(non-static sensitive, pyrotechnic).

item.title: Report X-2022060349
item.description:
Report X-2022060349

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-15T21:08:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-25
  • City: RINCON
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The PROX 17426 was found by BNSF employees to be leaking a small amount from the top of the car. The car was isolated and responders identified a small leak of sulfuric acid from the liquid line cap. The cap was found to be less than tool tight. Less than 1 KG of Sulfuric Acid was released from the car and isolated to the car body only, no environmental impacts. Sodium Bicarb was used to neutralize the acid on the car, the car was depressurized to inspect the cap and gasket. Once cleaned, the car was secured and released back into transportation.
